answers.answer: Hi, it could be due to the medications. Certain medications for high blood pressure and antidepressants can cause erectile dysfunction. Long term use of alcohol and illicit drugs can cause erectile dysfunction. Diabetes Mellitus is known to cause erectile dysfunction. Trauma, surgery and radiation is known to affect erectile function. Anxiety, stress, guilt and worry can further aggravate this problem. Please discuss these options with your doctor when he happens to meet him next time. If no cause is detected professional counseling may help. Regards.

question: I am 16wks pregnant and my bf doesnt seem interested in having sex for the past 3 months. Hes only 31 yrs old but takes high doses of blood pressure meds which he says is effecting his ability to get an erection. Needless to say, im frusterated and kind of sad because I'm not sure if it's really his meds or does he not find me attractive anymore now that I'm pregnant? Any advice?
title: blood pressure meds effecting my bf?
